title: How do you respond to toxicity? (For people who don't like to mute because it limits communication)
body: Personally, if someone is flaming, calling me names, or saying that I made them lose lane because I never ganked them (when they were pushed under the enemy turret every time I was on that side of the map and our ADC was out of mana and has 1/4 of his HP left), I like to remind them, and everyone else in /all, that "the mitochondria is the powerhouse of the cell". What about you?

replies.body:
I try to be positive. It's the only thing that turns it around. If they're toxic and bad and you're the one that's going to help the win the game then do it. Prove them wrong. 

I recently had my mf cry a river about my sup trundle because she died  when she all in'd at level 1 vs level 2's.  Screamed how bad I was to go ward jg because I saw the enemy jg run that direction and i didn't want my jg to get killed and I pinged that I was doing it. I said sorry, don't stress it. We'll recover, I promise, we got this shit. Took her 5 levels to stop. At that point, I got an e (road block and slow) on their sup and got her a kill, ulted their adc and dived, yi peeled around the corner and took them out, I leave tower half health. I said gj guys, awesome gank. Let's clear their jg and dragon. And we did.

By the end of the game I was impossible for them to kill me or the mf and she was 10/5. I said encouraging things the whole time and they literally didn't say a thing the entire rest of the game.

Specifically, people want to vent and blame someone when they make a mistake... What I've found is to let them be frustrated, tell them you'll help them or make it up to them. Then do it.  It's not foolproof. Sometime they're just going to go full retard and feed.  But this has helped me turn things around a lot.

When I'm not reminding people of the structure of building blocks of living organisms, I try and put in 'nice job' or 'ty' after a leash, even if they continually respond with 'no' and 'u suck' and, my personal favorite, 'u r noob'. If I'm continually nice throughout the game while they're consistently flaming me, they just look childish. Princess Passive strikes again!

I don't mean it like that. I'm sincere. I'm going to get them fed, I'll work hard to help them. TY after a leash that's expected is just lame. nj when you don't get the kill just sounds passive. When you run around the corner, save their ass and secure a kill for them, they realize it might be something they did wrong in the beginning cause all you did was say "don't stress, keep it up, ur doing fine, I'll help next time" and you then made good on it.

I've had troll games. I've had the 0/5 teemo sup at 8 minutes tell me I was terrible and let me 1v2 the whole game. He got 2 people on my own team and 2 people on the other team to think I WAS THE REASON HE DIED SO MUCH.... and I said sorry, I'll get you fed and help you recover. I got him a kill. I got myself one. I got him a 2nd and that was all he needed to go 12/11. He ran around the map damn near griefing people, csing and using blind to obliterate a team that was mostly physical.  I HATED this kid. I let it go with one end game screen of "please report teemo, he's a troll".

But saying nice job is for when they get the kill no matter where I am on the map, and I've actually been flamed at for not thanking the ADC for leashing. Several times. Has that ever happened to you? It only started happening fairly recently, actually.

I pretty much always GJ/NJ when someone on my team gets first blood, especially if I am jg but have nothing to do with it.

When I do jg I usually 'ty' for a good/normal leash and say nothing for a bad leash. I feel like I give pretty good leashes to jgers though so maybe I have high standards.  Never seen flaming either way, even if the leash sticks around too late and you/they have to double leash.

Trolls and ragers will do as they do. It's absurd to flame someone for not thanking you for something that's expected. Leashing is the single easiest way to ensure a good early game for your entire team. It's not optional except for champions that don't require a leash like shaco.

{{champion:103}} FEEDING WORTHLS PEICE OF TRASH
{{champion:33}} ok

Personally I tell them to go find the nearest bridge and jump off of it. Then I give them a 2-piece and a biscuit if they want to keep going. I don't normally start it.. but I for sure finish it and it usually ends with them crying "omg report this guy he's so toxic" after they get what's coming to them. It's hilarious how many kids can dish it out but they sure as hell can't take it.

Yes I did, but I would like to know the toxicity level of a plant during photosynthesis..

Toxicity has nothing to do with the process of photosynthesis and it is a means of defense rather than nutrition and would not increase or decrease as a direct result of photosynthesis. So if a plant is toxic during photosynthesis, then it is a poisonous plant all the time and any sort of contact should be avoided for your safety.

There are plenty of things I do:
1) Ignore them: no need to read that word next to their name, I still like to see the salt anyways in a sadistic way
2) Kill with Kindness: Simple GJ when they "deserve it" or more ganks, force them to be sorry for flaming
3) something I like to call "Global Harass:" Calling out the small things like "Scan the tri-bush, you'll find a squishy ______ in there" or my favorite, "$5 you Guys can't 1v5 the ______ on our team" Gets my team to back off as well (since who wouldn't want to see that?)

But "Global Harass" increases your chances of losing, and why lose when you can win? Why let the enemy get fed when you can get fed? When you're fed, you can make fun decisions, like, who on the enemy team doesn't get to play League today because they're too busy dying? Who's deaths are going to be in the double digits? "Global Harass" won't make that happen for you.

Honestly, I try to respond postively. If they're complaining or raging about being camped I offer helpful suggestions and I can only hope that they listen. In some cases, when X person is being persistantly toxic, I just ignore them without touching the Mute/Block button. It's easy to ignore whats being said in chat (I do it accidentally sometimes because I'm so focused) and its become a second nature to me. In the most extreme cases I wait until the end of the game to Mute/Block them so that if they _do_ say something productive or make good call. 

And I always remember to report them since a ban/restriction will be the only way they learn. Unless, of course, they continue with their toxic ways and earn themselves a perma ban. Then they can't really learn from their mistakes within this community but maybe they will take away where they went wrong and think on it when they join another community.
